intro: Sphaeroma rosea, commonly known as the rose sea hare, is a species of sea hare found in marine environments. It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its soft, gelatinous body covered in a layer of mucus. The animal has a distinctive rose-colored body with a rounded shape, which gives it its common name. It is primarily found in the Indo-Pacific region, including areas around Australia and Southeast Asia. Sphaeroma rosea feeds on algae and is known for its ability to secrete a defensive mucus that can deter predators.
